title: Ticket #5374: condor_history fails on a fresh installation
description:
# uname -a
Linux host-172-8-0-58 2.6.32-504.el6.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Oct 15 04:27:16 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux


# condor_version
$CondorVersion: 8.2.10 Oct 27 2015 $
$CondorPlatform: X86_64-CentOS_6.7 $


# rpm -qa | grep condor
condor-classads-8.2.10-1.1.osg32.el6.x86_64
condor-procd-8.2.10-1.1.osg32.el6.x86_64
condor-python-8.2.10-1.1.osg32.el6.x86_64
condor-8.2.10-1.1.osg32.el6.x86_64


# condor_history
 ID     OWNER          SUBMITTED   RUN_TIME     ST COMPLETED   CMD
Error opening history file /var/lib/condor/spool/history: No such file or directory

# echo $?
1



# python
Python 2.6.6 (r266:84292, Jan 22 2014, 09:42:36)
[GCC 4.4.7 20120313 (Red Hat 4.4.7-4)] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import htcondor
>>> import datetime
>>> t = int(datetime.datetime.now().strftime('%s')) -3600
>>> condor_constraint_expr = "JobStartDate > %s" %t
>>> schedd = htcondor.Schedd()
>>> jobs = schedd.history(condor_constraint_expr, ['RemoteWallClockTime'], 0)
>>> for job in jobs: print job
...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: Error opening history file
remarks:
2015-Nov-10 16:37:04 by johnkn:
This is not a bug, it has always worked that way. marking as enhancement.

2015-Nov-12 15:27:29 by tim:
Greg Thain reviewed this code.
check_ins:
2015-Nov-11 13:07   Check-in [46251]: version history for #5374 (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
2015-Nov-10 16:42   Check-in [46244]: change condor_history so it doesn't report an error if there is no history file. #5374 this changes the contract of the findHistoryFiles function so that it can return an empty list. ===VersionHistory:Pending=== (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
creator: jcaballero
